citeinfo.title: Twin Cities Metropolitan Area Regional Groundwater Flow Model, Version 2.00 (Metro Model 2) Calibrated Hydraulic Head Contours - Twin Cities Metropolitan Area, Minnesota

descript.abstract:
Groundwater flow in the Twin Cities metropolitan area was modeled using the finite difference modeling code MODFLOW-96 (McDonald and Harbaugh, 1988; Harbaugh and McDonald, 1996) as implemented in the modeling package Groundwater Vistas (version 5.09 build 16) (Environmental Simulations, Inc., 2007). This dataset defines contours of hydraulic head (feet above mean sea level) for each layer in the calibrated model (note: each model layer may represent more than one geologic unit). The hydraulic head contour represents head in the geologic unit present in that layer at that location. It is recommended that the user view these contours over a base map of bedrock geology or aquifer extent.This dataset is a direct output of the Metro Model 2, developed by Barr Engineering Company for the Metropolitan Council to support the development of a regional master water supply plan.
More information about this process is provided in the 2009 Metropolitan Council report 'Twin Cities Metropolitan Area Regional Groundwater Flow Model Version 2.00 - Technical Report in Support of the Metropolitan Area Master Water Supply Plan', which is available online at www.metrocouncil.org/environment/WaterSupply/metrogroundwatermodeldatasets.htm.
descript.purpose: The 2005 Minnesota Legislature directed the Metropolitan Council to "carry out planning activities addressing the water supply needs of the metropolitan area" (Minnesota Statutes, Section 473.1565). Specifically the Council is charged with developing a base of technical information for water supply planning decisions and to prepare a metropolitan area master water supply plan. This dataset supports this charge.
descript.supplinf: Twin Cities metropolitan area and parts of surrounding counties

timeperd.current: Data is based upon a regional groundwater flow model calibration completed in Spring 2009.

place.placekey: Twin Cities, Anoka County, Carver County, Dakota County, Hennepin County, Ramsey County, Scott County, Washington County, Minnesota

theme.themekey: water supply planning, groundwater flow model, Metro Model 2, calibrated hydraulic head, water level

idinfo.useconst: By acceptance of this data, the user agrees to include a copy of the metadata record, including the liability disclaimer, whenever the user transmits or provides the GIS data (or any portion of it) to another user.

citeinfo.title: Datasets described by this metadata: WaterLevelMonderPrairieduChienJordan WaterLevelModernFranconiaIrontonGalesville WaterLevelModernMtSimon

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.1.1332

cntinfo.cntpos: Sr. Environmental Scientist, Water Supply Planning

dataqual.complete: The entire seven county geographic area is covered, as well as portions of surrounding counties.

procstep.procdesc: After model calibration, 25 foot hydraulic head contours were exported for each model layer to ArcGIS shapefiles through Groundwater Vistas (Version 5.0).

overview.eaover:
FID
Shape
Contour - Hydraulic head contour in feet above sea level. Contour interval = 25 feet. Each model layer may represent more than one geologic unit; the hydraulic head contour represents the geologic unit present in that layer at that location. It is recommended that the user view these contours over a base map of bedrock geology or aquifer extent.

The GIS Data were developed by the Metropolitan Council for its own internal business purposes. The Metropolitan Council does not represent or warrant that the GIS Data or the data documentation are error-free, complete, current, or accurate. You are responsible for any consequences resulting from your use of the GIS Data or your reliance on the GIS Data. If you transmit or provide the GIS Data (or any portion of it) to another user, the GIS Data must include a copy of this disclaimer.

stdorder.ordering:
This dataset is distributed on the internet by clicking below after 'Online Linkage'. Doing so will tell your browser to download a 'ZIP' file which will contain the following:
- ArcView shape files - metadata for the dataset (.htm) - NOTICE.RTF, an important notice about this dataset that can be read by any word processing software.
This dataset can also be viewed and downloaded from the MetroGIS DataFinder Cafe at http://www.datafinder.org/cafe/ . The Cafe allows users to subset or clip datasets using an existing feature, such as a city or school district boundary or an ad-hoc, user defined area.
Additionally, this dataset is available for direct use via one or more map services. More information about what a web mapping service is can be found at http://www.datafinder.org/services/ . The specific map service and layer name for this dataset can be found by clicking the blue or green boxes under the map service column of the DataFinder Catalog at http://www.datafinder.org/catalog/ .

cntinfo.cntpos: Sr. Environmental Scientist, Water Supply Planning
